Elvira/Cassandra Peterson, Pam Grier, Kevin Smith, David Hasselhoff and of course Willard Wyler/Paul Reubens (may he rest in peace). This game will always have a place in my heart as being one of the best COD experiences who's potential was not seen nor encouraged by the fanbase... until it was too late to go back.

184909061.review: The campaign here is easily one of the best COD campaigns of all time. Gameplay is challenging and offers a various opportunities to switch up the classic combat loop. The Solar system setting is home to some of the best Sci-Fi world building the FPS genre has ever seen. Cutscenes are beautiful and well acted including a stunning performance from none other than Jon Snow himself. The enemy Martian SDF are basically the purest form of evil degeneracy mankind could muster so I don't have to feel too bad for sociopathically annihilating their entire command structure and manpower over a blisteringly fast paced guerila warfare campaign. The space combat has never been done this well before or since in the series (the only time it ever came close was the VTOL from BO2) , it's not a simulation by any measure but it makes for a really outstanding fun regardless. It's got emotional beats, action setpeices galore and the graphics hold up extremely well considering this is from a generation of games where developers were just getting their hands on advanced console graphics and hadn't sunk the entire optimization budget into cosmetics storefronts and battle pass integration. I wouldn't usually set an ultimatum like this, but if you don't appreciate the magnificent scale of this campaign, you might just be incompetent on more than a few levels. This game was a favorite of mine when it first released despite the lackluster critical response (critics all suck at FPS) I can't speak on the multiplayer now, it's sadly most likely a deadzone of low player counts or hackers galore, butback in the day it was one of the best and the local/private match system is extrememly functional. Hell some of the most fun I ever had playing COD involved 1v1 quickscope matches on split screen with my old college roomates. If this game is on sale, PICK IT UP. If not, and you're thinking about it, JUST DO IT. If you genuinely dislike this game, then you can direct message me and I'll 1v1 you MYSELF! ... oh how the mighty have fallen RIP Call of Duty 2003-2024

184734687.review:
[h3][b]Wtf is this?![/b][/h3]
[quote][b] Rating: 7.5/10 [/b][/quote]
[b]This game is total space shit.[/b]

As someone who even loved Advanced Warfare, I was underwhelmed. They should have just changed the name of the game at this point.

It has some game breaking bugs. I was stuck around the final mission because one bitch decided to not move, restarted the whole mission. Multiplayer and Zombies mode are completely dead. They crashe randomly in few minutes (Win 11), plus none players I could find. From what I played, Zombies felt good like in BO3.

Also, compared to all the other in the series, Veteran was insanely difficult. While Hardened was significantly easier. lol

For the campaign, there were one or two epic story & gameplay moments here and there, which let me not go lower on the rating. But it's not what it should have been... with that greedy price, and game breaking bugs with underwhelming campaign, it's a product of corporate greed.

[b]Not necessarily a bad one, but its a disappointing one.[/b]

184725958.review: WOW! I believe I have played all the CODs in history -- aside from WWII, and the newest one, being BO6 -- and I have to say they really outdid themselves with the campaign on this one. The story, the narration, the characters; it was all very well done and thought off. And when I thought it couldn't get better, freaking Kit Harrington shows up on my screen -- amazing! I loved every minute of this campaign, and I honestly gotta commend Infinity for their work here. Very well done. p.s.: the credits were top.freaking.NOTCH! With the story add ons, and the music -- which personally took me back to earlier CODs -- it all made me feel like it was one big Star Wars side story movie that I could somehow control. Again, well done with this one, Infinity.

184608076.review:
[h1]★★★★☆[/h1]
If I remember correctly the games initial trailed held some sort of record regarding dislikes on Youtube. I find this fact quite funny in retrospect because this is probably the COD game I enjoyed the most so far. The departure from the generic military setup was a nice breath of fresh air for me and I was able to say that COD Infinite Warfare was a really fun game, without having to say “It was a fun COD game” because it could be enjoyed as a normal game.

The game has a nice hub through which you initiate missions and even side missions. The robot that joins you throughout the experience made the game feel so much better than the otheres IMO. And the gameplay with the futuristic setting was a lot of fun.

Without having to compare it to anything for once I can outright just say this was a fun FPS and I would recommend you to check it out if you like FPS games, and/or SciFi ish games. I give COD Infinite Warfare 4/5.

184585700.review:
I never hated this game, i feel the only reason why it was so hated was because when it came out, it was the 3rd cod game with futuristic movement tech, and that it was largly written off because of what the special edition came with.
Everyone wanted its older brother more which truly does suck cos when you get to it, this game had a really good campaign which i only just got around to playing, and the story writers really wanted you to feel like this wasnt just a war, it was a battle for survival.
The multiplayer basically took what BO3 did but made everyone a faceless nobody soldier, every specialist was just a soldier you could easily find in the campaign and i appreciate that because every multiplayer character anymore has to be a part of the broader story of the game.
Zombies was not the best but it gave me something to do for awhile cos i was bored.
i Don't believe this game deserved the hate it got yes it had its flaws and issues but its still something worth picking up if you can get it on sale, and its not gonna hog your hard drive like the modern call of duty tittles.

184569926.review:
Writing this after completing the campaign on veteran. The campaign really is an absolute gem. The setting and story is quite engaging and fits right at home in sci-fi. Characters are wellwritten and you start to care for them despite how little time you spend with them overall. Mission progression being more open in the order you wish to complete them(or not) is a breath of fresh air from more railroaded campaign progression. Feels nice to have the option of choosing your next mission inbetween main story beats.

I highly recommend getting this game on sale for the campaign alone. It's well worth that.

Peace to the Fallen

184254506.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟 (3/5)
"Un retour aux bases de la franchise avec une campagne solide et un multijoueur dynamique, mais quelques lacunes qui nuisent à l'expérience."

Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare, développé par Infinity Ward et publié par Activision, a suscité de nombreuses réactions mitigées lors de sa sortie en 2016. Ce jeu est le treizième opus principal de la série Call of Duty, et il marque un tournant important en introduisant une guerre futuriste dans l'espace, avec une forte composante de science-fiction. L'ambiance de l'histoire, centrée sur des conflits interstellaires et des batailles dans l'espace, a divisé les fans, certains appréciant le changement de direction, tandis que d'autres ont regretté l'absence de la guerre terrestre classique qui a fait la renommée de la série.

Malgré un lancement quelque peu controversé, Infinite Warfare propose une expérience globalement agréable, avec une campagne solo solide, un mode multijoueur dynamique et des graphismes impressionnants, mais qui laisse quelques réserves, notamment sur la direction générale du gameplay.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une campagne solo immersive et bien écrite : L'un des points forts de Infinite Warfare réside dans sa campagne solo. L'histoire, bien que futuriste et orientée science-fiction, propose des personnages attachants, des dialogues intéressants et une trame narrative solide. Vous incarnez Nick Reyes, un officier de la Navy engagé dans un conflit avec une faction terroriste interstellaire. Le jeu se distingue par sa mise en scène cinématographique, avec des moments d'action intenses et des séquences de combat spatiales qui ajoutent de la variété à l'expérience.
✅ Graphismes et ambiance spatiale réussis : Visuellement, Infinite Warfare est impressionnant. Les effets spéciaux sont sublimes, avec des batailles spatiales spectaculaires, des vaisseaux futuristes et une direction artistique qui parvient à créer un monde crédible dans un futur lointain. La modélisation des vaisseaux et des environnements spatiaux est particulièrement réussie et donne un aspect épique aux affrontements. De plus, le jeu bénéficie d'une excellente fluidité, même sur des machines plus anciennes.
✅ Un mode multijoueur solide et dynamique : Comme pour la plupart des jeux Call of Duty, le mode multijoueur reste l'un des principaux attraits d'Infinite Warfare. Il propose des mécaniques de gameplay classiques qui ont fait le succès de la série, avec un système de progression bien ficelé et des armes variées. Les différents modes de jeu, y compris les classiques Team Deathmatch et Domination, sont très bien équilibrés, et les nouveaux éléments comme les "Specialist" (des personnages avec des compétences uniques) ajoutent un peu de fraîcheur. Le système de cartes et d'armement offre une bonne dose de personnalisation et de rejouabilité.
✅ Innovations intéressantes dans le gameplay : Le jeu introduit quelques nouvelles mécaniques intéressantes, telles que les batailles spatiales en zéro gravité et les vaisseaux qui apportent une nouvelle dynamique au gameplay. Les séquences en apesanteur offrent une expérience unique par rapport aux autres titres de la franchise et montrent que les développeurs ont osé sortir des sentiers battus. De plus, la possibilité de personnaliser l'équipement et d'explorer différents types de missions ajoute à la variété.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Un changement de direction controversé vers la science-fiction : L'un des plus grands défauts d'Infinite Warfare est la direction que le jeu a prise vers un univers de science-fiction avec des éléments futuristes. Bien que cela ait apporté de la nouveauté, de nombreux fans de la série Call of Duty, habitués aux combats modernes ou historiques, ont trouvé ce changement trop radical. Les combats dans l'espace, les vaisseaux et les nouvelles technologies semblent déconnectés de l'essence de la franchise, et le ton général du jeu a perdu un peu de la simplicité brute qui caractérisait les premiers opus de Call of Duty.
⚠️ L'absence d'un mode zombie traditionnel dans le jeu principal : Alors que Call of Duty est bien connu pour son mode Zombie, Infinite Warfare a opté pour une approche différente en introduisant un mode de zombies dans un univers totalement décalé. Ce mode est plutôt amusant et propose une expérience différente, mais il peut sembler étrange et moins mémorable par rapport aux itérations précédentes. Pour beaucoup, l'absence de la formule classique de zombies a été un manque, surtout pour les joueurs fidèles.
⚠️ Les mécaniques de mouvement futuristes divisent l’expérience : Infinite Warfare introduit de nouveaux éléments de gameplay comme le double saut, les glissades et les combats en apesanteur, empruntés à des jeux comme Advanced Warfare ou Black Ops 3. Si ces ajouts ont été appréciés par certains joueurs, d'autres ont trouvé que cela dénaturait l'expérience de Call of Duty, en apportant un côté "over-the-top" au gameplay. Ces mécaniques de mouvement futuristes, bien que divertissantes, peuvent rendre le gameplay plus chaotique et moins tactique, ce qui peut déplaire aux puristes de la franchise.
⚠️ La répétitivité de certaines missions et des ennemis : Bien que la campagne offre une histoire intéressante et une grande variété de missions, certaines peuvent devenir répétitives au bout d’un moment. Les types d’ennemis ne sont pas toujours très originaux, et le design des missions peut se ressentir comme étant un peu prévisible. En plus, les séquences de batailles spatiales, bien qu'intéressantes au début, peuvent finir par se répéter et perdre en impact au fil du temps.

En conclusion :
Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare est un jeu qui présente des éléments impressionnants mais qui, en fin de compte, laisse un goût mitigé. La campagne solo est solide, avec une histoire captivante, des personnages intéressants et une immersion dans un univers futuriste fascinant. Le mode multijoueur est également un point fort, avec une expérience classique et dynamique, même si les changements apportés au gameplay peuvent diviser les joueurs. Cependant, la prise de risques dans l'univers de science-fiction n'a pas été unanimement appréciée, et le manque de certaines mécaniques traditionnelles de la série, comme le mode Zombie classique, pourrait décevoir les puristes. Malgré tout, le jeu reste une expérience agréable pour les amateurs de Call of Duty et ceux en quête de nouveautés.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé : 10 à 12 heures pour la campagne principale.
🎮 Verdict final : Un jeu solide qui propose une histoire intéressante et un mode multijoueur efficace, mais qui souffre de quelques choix de conception controversés.

184194297.review:
Playing with bots on multiplayer is satisfying - they seem to work on the relatively fantastic code of COD Ghost's bots (dropshotting, jumping around corners to surprise you, throwing all kinds of grenades, using special abilities). The campaign is gorgeous and has some wonderful characters (my fav, Salter). The weapons, especially the NV4 and VOLK are sublime in terms of sounds and animations.
Pick this up on sale, along with the season pass if you like MP Bots/Zombies, and you might be surprised at how charming the experience is.

One of my favorite COD game from the series.
This was the game that inducted me into the series, as I was more of a 'non FPS' type of person.
The sci-fi genre which was a turn off for mainstay fans, ironically was the reason I got intrigued.

Good gunplay, characters you get invested in, and the part where you ascend into space with your fighter jet.
That part gives me goosebumps every time I see it.

184064799.review:
Algumas opiniões minhas desse jogo:
Campanha:
Pra mim esse é a campanha com os personagens mais humanizados da franquia, eles possuem conflitos, medos e motivações ótimas (só deixam a desejar um pouquinho na personalidade), a ambientação é outro ponto extremamente positivo em vários momentos parei para admirar o espaço. A gameplay das naves no meu ver é a melhor da franquia (Existem várias missões com elas). Porém um ponto negativo é o antagonista, por mais que ele seja uma grande ameaça sua presença é praticamente 0.
9/10 pra mim é top 10 campanhas de cod.

Multiplayer:
Joguei muito mais esse MP no ps4 quando o jogo lançou (hoje não tem uma alma viva nos servers), particularmente acho ele mais polido do que BO3 (em gameplay), os mapas estão na média, e o sistema de variantes e lootbox são um pouco mais justos que BO3 e AW mas inferior ao de WWII, a grande maioria das armas tem um feeling legal, e também existe o sistema de "modo de disparo" (algo assim) que eu sinto muita falta. O SBMM era praticamente inexistente e o ttk era médio.
8/10 era bem divertido mas ta morto.

Zombies:
Atualmente não fiz todos os Easter Eggs mas ainda pretendo, a história é mais focada no humor e esteriótipos (não leve ela tanto a sério) mas é extremamente divertida, os mapas são bacanas, o quarteto é legal e o vilão também, a temática é impecável e as bossfights parecem muito boas.
9/10 pra mim o melhor zombies que não foi feito pela Treyarch.

Conclusão: 
Infinite Warfare foi um ótimo cod lançado no momento errado, ele tomou um hate EXTREMO pela sua temática e por ser o terceiro cod futurista seguido, muitos não deram chance devido a isso e no meu ver perderam uma experiencia satisfatória, pra mim esse foi o ultimo cod bom da Infinity Ward ja que MW19 e MW22 são horriveis.
PODE COMPRAR SEM MEDO (em promoção)

Obrigado por ler :)

8 or so years since I last played this game, saw a nostalgic video of zombies in Spaceland. checked to see if it was on offer and it was so here I am. 8 years later buying all the DLC's just for the zombies experience and you know what... It does not disappoint.
If you miss the spaceland scooby doo/ arcade game type vibe just bite the bullet and get this if its on offer. Game holds up better now than I remember it doing in the initial release, 

Just an honest shame I cant find squad players for Zombies.

Lets hope one day Activision give this Zombies dev team a chance to continue this story line, Without a doubt the best experience outside of the best few Treyarch maps

183930806.review:
First and foremost, it’s important to clarify that this review will focus solely on the single-player narrative component—the Campaign. I will not touch on the multiplayer mode, which appears to be essentially dead (finding an online match in Europe seems near impossible), nor on the cooperative Zombies mode. While Zombies in Call of Duty has long been the domain of Treyarch, I’m curious to see how Infinity Ward handles it, though that’s a topic for another time.

A Personal Milestone in the Call of Duty Series

Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare marked a significant milestone for me as it was the last Call of Duty campaign I played after many years of following the franchise. Being an iterative series with annual releases, there are plenty of campaigns to go through, but with this one, I can finally say I’ve played and completed every Call of Duty title—at least until the next one drops in 2025 (and the cycle repeats).

A Refreshing Approach to the Campaign

Infinite Warfare takes the series into uncharted territory with its sci-fi space warfare theme, a stark departure from the grounded, modern, or historical settings we had been accustomed to before its release in 2016. While the campaign retains many of the familiar elements of Call of Duty—cinematic action, high-octane sequences, and a well-paced narrative—it distinguishes itself through its structure and execution.

Gone are the repetitive mission-to-mission transitions and formulaic cutscenes. Instead, Infinite Warfare introduces seamless mission continuity, allowing you to explore your ship, interact with the crew, and even choose optional side missions spread across the solar system. These additions give the game a sense of agency and immersion that few other Call of Duty titles achieve. The gameplay also benefits from varied mechanics, such as Star Wars-esque dogfights in space, planetary exploration, and intense infantry battles.

A Story Worth Investing In

What truly sets Infinite Warfare apart is its well-crafted story and characters. Unlike previous campaigns, which often featured over-the-top, cringe-worthy narratives that felt forced, this game delivers a narrative that feels sincere and heartfelt. You’ll find yourself empathizing with the characters, understanding their motivations, and becoming emotionally invested in their fates. It’s rare for a Call of Duty game to evoke genuine emotion, but Infinite Warfare accomplishes this with ease, delivering moments that tug at your heartstrings and might even bring a tear to your eye.

Visuals and Presentation

Visually, Infinite Warfare is a feast for the eyes. From the stunning cosmic vistas to the meticulous attention to detail in the environments, the game is nothing short of breathtaking. Every element of the presentation feels polished, underscoring the passion and dedication that Infinity Ward poured into the project.

Conclusion

If you can look past the sci-fi setting—which may not appeal to everyone—the campaign in Infinite Warfare is an absolute gem. It’s worth playing, even if you haven’t touched another Call of Duty game, because it offers something truly unique within the series. Infinity Ward clearly put their heart and soul into this title, and it shows. From the “Jetpack era” of Call of Duty, Infinite Warfare undoubtedly stands out as the best campaign of the bunch.

For its narrative depth, emotional resonance, and bold approach to storytelling, Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare’s campaign is a must-play for fans of cinematic single-player experiences.

183571727.review: Diferente dos CODs mais atuais, aonde a campanha é um tanto quanto vazia (MW3 é um otimo exemplo), esse COD aqui tem uma campanha boa. Sendo um COD da era futurista, eu tive um certo preconceito na hora de testar a campanha, porem acabei me surpreendendo com o desenvolvimento e com os personagens (principalmente o Ethan). Infelizmente o preço dos jogos mais antigos da franquia é extremamente alto ate mesmo em promoçoes, se tu for uma pessoa que busca comprar os CODs pela campanha, esse vale a pena. Não sou muito chegado no modo zombies, porem lendo e pesquisando um pouco aqui, vi que muitos consideram o modo zombies do infinity, um dos melhores da franquia. Dito tudo isso, eu recomendo a compra só em promoçoes, o preço cheio desse jogo chega a ser ridiculo.
